intro: Anaphalioides trinervis, commonly known as the three-veined anaphalioides, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its delicate, small yellow flowers that are typically arranged in composite heads. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often hairy, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in sandy or rocky soils. Anaphalioides trinervis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands, where it plays a minor role in local ecosystems.
